meanings.definition: The act of disapproving or expressing disapproval.
meanings.sent1: Her disapproval was evident when she shook her head at the messy room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's disapproval was clear when she gave a stern look to the student talking in class.
meanings.sent3: His disapproval of pineapple on pizza was met with laughter by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The disapproval of his actions hung over him like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The disapproval in her eyes made him realize he had made a big mistake.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being disapproved.
meanings.sent1: Living in constant disapproval from others can be stressful.
meanings.sent2: His disapproval of the situation was palpable in the room.
meanings.sent3: The disapproval of the weather for the picnic was comical.
meanings.sent4: The disapproval of the old building was like a weight on the community.
meanings.sent5: The disapproval of her outfit was hard to miss.

meanings.sent1: The disapproval of his proposal was disappointing.
meanings.sent2: She felt the disapproval of her peers as she presented her idea.
meanings.sent3: The disapproval of the new movie was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The disapproval of his behavior was like a slap in the face.
meanings.sent5: The disapproval of the decision lingered in the room.
